page.title: 19THE KNUCKER HOLE
page.content: Knucker holes are supposed to be bottomless. According to local estate agents, fisheries department, the one at the Decoy House, Lyminster, near Arundel is only 30 feet deep, and fed by a stray underground spring. From this pool, the Knucker Hole Trust Fishery of Three Lakes takes its name. The word Knucker is descended from Anglo Saxon 'nicor', a water monster. Every knucker hole had its monster and local legend has it that the Lyminster monster was slain by a knight errant whose tombstone, with no inscription, but dating from medieval times can be seen in Lyminster church.
